text: I would give a 5 starts, but the last releases don't work in Chrome, if Application > Service Worker > Update on reload is enabled, in the dev tools. Is this intended behavior? Cheers!
Recent days Ember inspector is working only in incognito window not in normal window.

After the latest update Ember inspector tab is not found in the devtools 

it works on some profiles  of the same browser 

I am using Chrome 119

All my team mates are facing the same issue please fix this soon

Thanks
Latest update is unusable. Thanks for nothing.
Rarely works, unfortunately there's no alternative
Useful, but having access to data like models would help a bit more.
Must have when working with Ember,
Doesn't work after latest Chrome update
Awesome extension but doesn't work after last update.

It's an excellent tool for developing ember apps. BUT as it is implemented on every web-page it leads to visual errors on some. I noticed a navigation missing on a page I was visiting or other less dramatic appearance-changes. 
I recommend this tool for developing but also urge users to deactivate it when you are not developing.

This was a pretty solid extension until recently, when it completely stopped working for my sole use case: debugging GUI modding for the game Stonehearth, which uses an old version (1.0.8 I think) of Ember. Now I just get a blank white page when connecting to it in Chrome or Firefox with this extension.

Edit: adjusted to 5 stars; looks like it's a problem with Chrome and Firefox; it works in SlimJet.
Awesome!
Ember and Ember-Inspector are amazing. I've used Vue and KO among other frameworks but there is something to be said about how cleanly Ember maps to CRUD web apps.
I think this extension should be on the EmberJS homepage, and perhaps somewhere prominently mentioned in the docs. Great work as come to be expected of the EmberJS dev community :)
The bomb
Makes working with ember a pleasure.
A must-have for Ember developers!  It's also fun using it to find other sites developed with Ember.
Productivity without compromising ergonomics - thank you Ember ♥️
Must have![2]
I can't imagine developing an Ember app without the help of this extension.
ember is awesome
Works as intended!

Great extension, but it doesn't work after latest update. "Error message: Cannot add property toString, object is not extensible"

Very good extension!
thanks
Amazing
Wow. Get to know the Ember Internals with this Amazing Ember Inspector!

The go to tool to help explore Ember.js applications, both your own when developing, as well as publicly accessible websites such as Discourse forums.
give your more staff than a normal console :)
Its a must for any ember app.
A must have for debugging Ember apps.
Must have tool!
Ember Inspector is a fine addon.  It recently started blocking certain pdfs from loading, though, so I had to disable it.

Great tool. Provides great information and help.

Has some minor issues that need to be fixed though
Simply awesome handy tool
Such a great idea, brilliant execution. If you're working with ember get this extension.
Must have!
A MUST have for any ember developer. Beautiful extension.

Amazing! Except for a weird bug that crashes the panel whenever a live reload occurs with Ember CLI 1.13. Reproduced it on several computers (all running Mac OSX if that makes a difference). Hope they fix this soon as the plugin is perfect beyond that.
Ember changes the life of web developers! Thanks a lot!
Realy helpfull, thank you guys

One of the most useful Chrome extensions. Invaluable if you're an Ember dev.

really helpful!Emberjs is great!

Super helpful. I don't know how I would build apps without this at this point.

Extremely helpful tool for Ember developers!
Extremely useful, a must-have for Ember.js developers. You can clearly see everything that's going on, from templates to errors.
An amazing tool for Ember Devs. Ember is a complex system and this helps crack it open and keep things manageable.

I couldn't really rate it properly since I haven't gotten around to using it, but I DID track it down as the cause of a problem with an ajax call on a Drupal site. It broke the site to the point of me spending hours debugging only to find that a browser plugin was the problem. For that reason, I give it 1 star for breaking simple ajax functionality. I hope to come back and revise the review once I have a chance to use it on an ember app.
soo oh oh good

This extension is awesome! Very helpful when developing apps.

Solid tool, works well. Very helpful in debugging ember routing and data issues. Provided a lot of de-mystification of those two modules as I was learning.
Awesome tool, so much prettier than Batarang for Angular...
I love this extension. I've been using it for a while, since before it was available in the Chrome Web Store. It has really grown and I couldn't live without it.

Great extension. Wish there was a tutorial somewhere, as the overview says, "Make your application's objects available in the console as the $E variable," and I have no idea how to get that work. Otherwise, great.
Great tool
Saw a good review. I am new to this. I am exploring it.
Looking good!
Absolutely magic. Just works. Being able to see loaded route states, the entire view hierarchy, and the current Data state is invaluable. Fantastic stuff.
Awesome extension, very usefull!
Great!!!
awesome
Super inspector!
Awesome. Make it very easy to debug ember.
Finally a great way to get to understand your ember-app better as well as helping with debugging. Looking forward to further improvements.
Excellent. Absolutely required for Ember app. If I see No Ember Application Detected, then I know some error with my javascript so console errors are helpful then.
Nice work. Looking forward for further improvements ;-)
Terrific.  A huge help in visualizing your Ember app.
Nice! Easy to use and powerful.

If you are seeing "No Ember App Detected", and you are opening from disk (as opposed to from a web server - ie. it's a file:/// url), then you have to turn on "Allow access to file URLs" in the Extensions settings.
It gives me a "No Ember Application Detected" message for every ember app I open  :(
Excellent job. It's incredible to be able to interact in such depth with the application. Kudos to all involved!
